document_data.caption: A map of Hordelands tribal territories, showing that of the Oigur.
document_data.name: Oigur
document_data.mainbody: The '''Oigur''' were a tribe of nomadic [[human]]s living in the [[Hordelands]].{{Cite dragon/349/The Horde: Barbarians of the Endless Waste|48}} They were among the tribes mistakenly called "[[Tuigan]]" by outsiders following the [[Horde Wars]].
document_data.Territory: The Oigur lived in the southern wastes of the Hordelands. Their territory bordered the lands of the [[Tuigan]], [[Quirish]], and [[Kashghun]] tribes.
document_data.Society:
They spoke [[Oigur language|their own language]].

They were considered rivals of the [[Naican]] but were allied with the [[Gur]].
document_data.History:
For many ages, the [[Dalat]] had raided Naican territory, and the Oigur would sometimes join them in this, leading to the feud between the Naican and Oigur.

When [[Yamun Khahan]] came to power and formed his [[Grand Army of the Tuigan]], the Oigur were the second tribe to fall to his conquest. The Oigur became friends with the Gurs, so as not to anger Yamun Khahan.
